definitions.definition: Apparent , evident ; meant for open display .
Appearing as such; being such in appearance; professed, supposed (rather than demonstrably true or real).
examples: The ostensible reason for his visit to New York was to see his mother, but the real reason was to get to the Yankees game the next day.

main_definition: Apparent , evident ; meant for open display .
secondary_definitions: Appearing as such; being such in appearance; professed, supposed (rather than demonstrably true or real).
